file_content.text: You've done it! Amazing, truly amazing!
Captain Vakar awaits.
Your accomplishments continue to astound. It seems there's nothing you can't do.
The enemies of House Organa are beginning to fear that we aren't the easy pickings they'd presumed. Now we need to drive that idea home.
If we could face down the men behind it all, their followers might finally give up the war.
Confront their leaders.
If we foil all of your enemies' remaining operations, no one will doubt your strength.
We shatter their last plans.
I agree--I think that's our best route to victory.
We locate their leaders' hiding spots and burn them out. The rest is just cleanup.
Let's take the fight to them.
Unfortunately, our enemies' leadership is far away. I think a show of strength here is what's most important.
Tell them to send their best, and I'll drop them before their weapons clear their holsters.
Arrange a straight-up duel.
I wish our enemies would agree to something so clear and honorable. But they prefer subterfuge.
How do we make sure your enemies back off for good?
What do you have in mind?
I was hoping we were finished here.
So we're not done?
The battle is leaning our way, but we must still land the finishing blow.
A Republic soldier, Captain Vakar, is stationed in the House Trader's Circle, an old marketplace within King's Pass.
Vakar reports our enemies are engaged in secretive dealings in the area. If you can interrupt their most hidden activities, House Organa will seem unbeatable.
Let Captain Vakar know that help is on the way.
I'm on it.
Any chance of getting some help on this one?
Do I get backup this time?
I'm afraid our forces are too diminished to spare anyone, but I suspect the missions ahead are best accomplished without great numbers anyway.
I'm not helping any more after this, got it?
This better be the end.
If all goes to plan, your help should no longer be necessary once this last task is complete.
Best of luck.
We welcome any more assistance you can provide.
Our avengers arrive, and no worse for wear. Welcome.
Our hero, in the flesh. Welcome.
I am Jeren Nolus Organa, seventh cousin of our honored duke. It's an honor to meet you--and the medical supplies you bring are much appreciated.
Did the attack do a lot of damage? Are the injuries severe?
Is everyone alright?
Many of our best fighters were wounded, and a great deal of our equipment has been disabled. But we carry on.
I was under the impression that House Organa's nobles didn't think this area was important.
I didn't expect a noble.
Most don't. But I haven't forgotten how Colonel Malcom defended our world from the Empire. I will stand by him, no matter what.
I don't care whose cousin you are. You shouldn't have let the Ulgos take you by surprise.
How could you fail like this?
We did the best we could with the resources we have. As Colonel Malcom predicted, it wasn't enough--which is why you're here now.
Many of the others in the camp would be honored to show their regards. Very fine people, very... up on current events.
Ahem... SIS....
Yes, we must double our efforts to rebuild our defenses and ensure that no threats to House Organa go unchecked. I won't delay you further.
I should have a word with these friends of yours.
Time to work.
Yes, I'm sure you'll have a great deal to discuss.
Be sure you take a moment to have those wounds looked at.
Get your injuries checked.
My injuries are trivial next to the others'. I'll be fine, thank you.
Good luck to you.
This camp had better not get destroyed on your watch, understand?
Try not to mess up again.
My resolve is not in question. We would all defend this point with our last breaths--some of my men already have.
Go, and do what you can.
Greetings.
